data.text: On Wednesday, June 24 at 9:00am ET, we will release an update to the World Economic Outlook report with the latest growth forecasts for the #globaleconomy. Watch @GitaGopinath’s presentation. #WEO  https://t.co/Bjg0CCm7qW https://t.co/i488M56jpe
Amid lockdowns, governments are turning to #fintech to help get money into the hands of people in need. #IMFBlog #COVID19 https://t.co/eDlUq4cA4Y https://t.co/8DiMnzo9JQ

This is precisely the moment to integrate climate issues into policymaking. If there’s one lesson this pandemic has taught us, it’s "Don’t mess with Mother Nature."
Read the opening remarks here:  https://t.co/JnfDUeZirV #ClimateAction #SustainableRecovery #GreenRecovery https://t.co/H4X9koFeQn

DMD Zhang made a case for #CarbonPricing at the Carbon Pricing Leadership Coalition High-Level Dialogue:
“The right prices will help ensure investment is allocated to the right sectors & also will generate much needed fiscal revenues.” #SustainableRecovery @WorldBank https://t.co/7jCoOQ2wyx

Subscribe now for cutting-edge research and analysis of key economic, finance and development issues shaping the world including COVID-19, climate change, corruption, fintech, trade, inequality and more. Click here to stay informed: https://t.co/N25Tb9HJHh https://t.co/ncJOy17N7z
Safeguarding #Africa’s food security in the age of COVID-19. https://t.co/3q8xZDUH4g #IMFAfrica #IMFBlog

1 out of 10 migrants in the world—or 25 million people—are #refugees or asylum seekers. New IMF research looks at policies that can help refugee integration and maximize the positive effects of migration. Read #WEO Chapter 4: https://t.co/opab9eFFEn #RefugeeDay https://t.co/aaDSPw5OG5

A recent poll of top economists found that the vast majority felt the #COVID19 pandemic will worsen inequality, in part through its disproportionate impact on low-skilled workers. More on #IMFBlog: https://t.co/xisXkJg7fA
In a special series of notes, we explore how governments can support people and firms during #COVID19. Download the latest notes here: https://t.co/OKASSzpHeb https://t.co/RDoGYM6J50

The IMF has taken decisive action to help countries, large and small, fight the #COVID19 economic crisis with the creation of a new Short-term Liquidity Line. This facility further strengthens the global financial safety net to tackle the crisis. https://t.co/nRW9GRx7Fi #IMFBlog https://t.co/e3q9vYsrn7

What if the economy had shock absorbers like your car to prevent major shocks when the economy hits a pothole? And what if those shock absorbers could be installed before the economy runs into trouble? This video explains automatic stabilizers. https://t.co/CFZpOSw0F2 https://t.co/vm2AKG9GLz

The COVID‑19 pandemic has amplified hopes that closing the remaining digital divide can transform economies and lives across sub-Saharan Africa. https://t.co/r8mwMfM1TV #IMFAfrica #DigitalAfrica

Are you on LinkedIn? Subscribe to our new IMF Weekend Read LinkedIn newsletter—a weekly round-up of the latest IMF research and analysis on global economics, finance, development and policy issues shaping the world. Read Friday's edition here: https://t.co/LcaecHWami https://t.co/mikI71BO2W
Key actions taken by 193 countries to respond to #COVID19 are listed in our Policy Tracker: https://t.co/hDP0Gi0i7n

The virus-related disruption to #education has left millions of children at risk of “learning poverty.” We need more investment in education, improving the quality of education, and access to life-long learning & re-skilling. Read @KGeorgieva’s #IMFBlog https://t.co/dr0meo3IkE https://t.co/WsnNzuhNZI

The IMF is providing emergency financial assistance and debt relief to member countries facing the economic impact of the #COVID19 pandemic. Find out which have so far received emergency financial assistance: https://t.co/lJlAHDqkKl https://t.co/xJdLjx1hpU
For #Pacific Island countries, #COVID19 may inflict deeper economic wounds than even the worst natural disaster. https://t.co/zYc3ucWYOE #IMFCountryFocus

Political economy plays an incredibly important role in our search to explain why things are working or not. This issue of F&D magazine explores economic policymaking and politics in light of the global pandemic. https://t.co/Uj7S2MYDAB #IMFBlog #COVID19 https://t.co/WbhzIrwECJ

#Corruption can divert much needed resources away from those who need them the most. This week @KGeorgieva spoke to @anticorruption to address the misuse of emergency #COVID19 funding. https://t.co/gf8LCHHT13 https://t.co/ummamIR1xY

Sustaining the fight against #corruption and preventing the misuse of emergency #COVID19 funding are essential to ensure that needed assistance reaches the most vulnerable people. https://t.co/qmwPqLnCzg https://t.co/BRELyHEXpx

Sustainable #economicrecovery hinges depends on strong economic institutions that enable resilient and inclusive policies. Read more here https://t.co/rqPVhDKaOm #IMFBlog #IMFCapDev https://t.co/MqViUkxQBx
How are we helping low-income countries during the #COVID19 pandemic? Learn more https://t.co/k0if0aElzD https://t.co/PNbrnBSHwB
The #pandemic has put the brakes on #migration, but economies depend on #migrants in many ways. Listen to the @imf_podcast https://t.co/cfzdo6z4N8 https://t.co/LaelSrMT4M

Sub-Saharan Africa is racing to close the global digital divide. Internet penetration in the region has grown tenfold since the early 2000s, compared with a threefold increase in the rest of the world. https://t.co/r8mwMfM1TV #DigitalAfrica #IMFCountryFocus

The #COVID19 pandemic has generated renewed interest in short-time work programs—the state-sponsored work-sharing schemes aimed at saving jobs. Read more on #Kurzarbeit, #Germany’s short-time work program and widely considered the gold standard of such programs.
What are the measures taken by #Nigeria to enhance transparency and governance in the use of the $3.4 billion IMF emergency financing? https://t.co/0zqIbYZ9Xs #IMFAfrica https://t.co/akAMj0ye1J

The IMF Executive Board today approved US$148 million for #Guinea to address the #COVID19 pandemic. This is the 70th request for emergency financing approved since the start of the crisis. #IMFAfrica https://t.co/DfiapqjY90 https://t.co/65IvyuLwDV
The June 2020 issue of IMF Finance & Development magazine focuses on economic policymaking and politics in light of the global pandemic. https://t.co/jvvJOZuHoF

But most #refugees settle in emerging & developing economies where they find it difficult to enter the job market. Strong international policy coordination is needed to tackle these challenges. #WorldRefugeeDay https://t.co/opab9eFFEn https://t.co/bYDDDQyOOz

#WEO research on the economic impact of migration finds that besides providing people with an opportunity for a better life, migration also brings gains to recipient countries (#AdvancedEconomies), increasing output and productivity in the short and medium term.

#Corruption hurts everyone. It corrodes the government's ability to respond effectively to the #COVID19 crisis. @KGeorgieva addresses the misuse of emergency #COVID19 funding in her interview with @anticorruption. #UnitedAgainstCorruption https://t.co/Nqs52X9hm1

As attention turns to the post‑#COVID19 recovery, four policy pillars can help guide how countries #InvestInDigitalAfrica – infrastructure, policies, people and skills, and resilience to risks. https://t.co/pL64j6tiTR #IMFAfrica

The latest #IMFAfrica research illustrates how policies can help support #DigitalAfrica and build more resilient, digital economies for the post-pandemic recovery. https://t.co/r8mwMfM1TV https://t.co/baobrcTW4z

Countries in the #Balkans have benefited from the IMF decision to double the annual access limits for rapidly-disbursing loans to fight #COVID19. Learn more here: https://t.co/3nw4OSEdKb https://t.co/9SipJz1Cjv
Food security in #Africa is under threat. #ClimateChange and epidemics are making it worse. Our #IMFBlog post talks about the 4 critical things governments can do. https://t.co/3q8xZDUH4g #IMFAfrica

.@KGeorgieva: Coming out of the #COVID19 crisis we have to think of sustainable and inclusive growth for the future. I want to see my grandchildren growing-up in a world that is prosperous, sustainable, and fair. #TIME100Talks https://t.co/4eLWX5nRSD

“IMF research has shown that more inequality—all other things equal—actually damages growth prospects,” explains @KGeorgieva during her conversation with @PoppyHarlowCNN at #TIME100Talks. https://t.co/1YQYgDsJ2T

IMF’s Managing Director @KGeorgieva speaking at #TIME100Talks stressed the importance of taking the right policy actions during the #COVID19 crisis to make a “great revival” rather than a “great reversal.” https://t.co/cx6Rmkliyg

Sustaining the fight against #corruption and preventing the misuse of emergency #COVID19 funding are essential to ensure that needed assistance reaches the most vulnerable people. Read @anticorruption’s interview with @Kgeorgieva here https://t.co/omhxIZBEcK https://t.co/mv8GLT59WO

Sub-Saharan Africa is racing to close the global digital divide. Internet penetration in the region has grown tenfold since the early 2000s, compared with a threefold increase in the rest of the world. https://t.co/r8mwMfM1TV #DigitalAfrica #IMFCountryFocus https://t.co/WVZhFcGDY9

Join IMF First Deputy Managing Director @gwsokamoto and @AEI’s Desmond Lachman for a webinar on the IMF’s response to #COVID19. Watch LIVE – Thursday, June 18 at 2pm ET. #IMFCovid19Response @AEIecon 

Details here: https://t.co/GXUIzYi1pv https://t.co/1unQgttcQ5

In her latest #IMFblog, @GitaGopinath underlines the striking divergence of financial markets from the real economy, with financial indicators pointing to stronger prospects of a recovery than real activity suggests. https://t.co/V7zWlrDhpK https://t.co/IO0aq654co

The IMF will support governments in adopting measures to #fightcorruption, such as: 

✔️Publish procurement contracts online
✔️Commission independent audits
✔️Improve transparency & public financial management
✔️Step up #anticorruption & #antimoneylaundering measures https://t.co/mkpuPa9pIO

In the peak months of the #GreatLockdown, the contraction in services has been even larger than in manufacturing in both advanced and emerging market economies. Read @GitaGopinath’s latest #IMFblog https://t.co/MD1Fp9n6fS https://t.co/ChJNLMARQL

#Kurzarbeit — Germany’s short-time work program—already seems to be playing an important role in preserving jobs during the current pandemic, says the IMF’s mission chief for #Germany. https://t.co/1xFvAdbDL6 https://t.co/nmsx0rZ0mN

For example, the services sector is being hit much harder than manufacturing, overall inflation is drifting down while food inflation increases, and financial markets are showing stronger prospects of a recovery despite economic collapse. Read the blog: https://t.co/Qee1khxKNh

In her latest blog, @GitaGopinath describes how the #GreatLockdown is playing out in unique ways, and how these characteristics are emerging all over the world, irrespective of the size, geographic region, or production structure of economies.

.@GitaGopinath: The #COVID19 crisis is truly a global crisis. For the first time since the #GreatDepression, both advanced & emerging market economies will be in recession in 2020, with negative growth rates likely worse than previously forecast in #WEO https://t.co/Qee1khxKNh https://t.co/j0qDCvZ1Yh

#COVID19 is a global challenge that requires a global response. International tax cooperation plays a key role in facing this crisis. #PCTPartners IMF @OECDtax @UNDESA @WBG_Gov explain how in a new blog. https://t.co/auoKn39b8Y #Tax4Dev
ICYMI: @KGeorgieva's conversation with @GLOBSEC, @Bruegel_org and @i_montaigne, watch the video and read the summary here: https://t.co/4hCywL6JzG #ResilientEconomies https://t.co/SyM1CYc5Qo

In a fireside conversation with @GLOBSEC, @Bruegel_org and @i_montaigne, Managing Director @KGeorgieva reiterated the need to build a shared platform that will work towards a greener, digital, resilient and sustainable economy. https://t.co/UJOywhQt1B #ResilientEconomies https://t.co/IJUJw3ZV6V

#Kurzarbeit, #Germany's short-time work scheme, was instrumental in keeping employment stable during the global financial crisis. But this crisis is likely to be even more profound. Will this program be as effective this time around? #COVID19 https://t.co/1xFvAdbDL6 https://t.co/CO1Z2cL6If

.@KGeorgieva: All European countries are going to end 2020 with lower per capita income than that which they started the year. That reversal of fortunes is a shock that, fortunately, has been matched by the magnitude of  the economic response. #ResilientEconomies https://t.co/xLka4rdoAQ
